q1.question: Which of the following statements regarding the functions in graph.py are true (select all that apply)?

responses.index_error: <tt>int()</tt> raises an <tt>IndexError</tt> when it tries to convert an empty <tt>string</tt>.
responses.value_error: <tt>int()</tt> raises a <tt>ValueError</tt> when it tries to convert an empty <tt>string</tt>.
responses.am_v: Given V vertices, an adjacency matrix requires at least O(V) space.
responses.am_v2: Given V vertices, an adjacency matrix requires at least O(V^2) space.
responses.al_v: Given V vertices, an adjacency list requires at least O(V) space.
responses.al_v2: Given V vertices, an adjacency list requires at least O(V^2) space.

q2.question: Which of the following statements regarding the time and space complexities of the functions in center_star.py are true (select all that apply)?

responses.fc_space_ve: find_center has an average space complexity of O(V + E).
responses.fc_time_ve: find_center has an average time complexity of O(V + E).

q3.question: Suppose we changed the graph representation in center_star.py from an adjacency matrix to an adjacency list. What would be the average time complexity of find_center with an adjacency list?

responses.fc_time_1: find_center would have an average time complexity of O(1).
responses.fc_time_v: find_center would have an average time complexity of O(V).
responses.fc_time_ve: find_center would have an average time complexity of O(V + E).
responses.fc_time_v2: find_center woudl have an average time complexity of O(V^2).

q4.question: Which of the following statements regarding the time and space complexities of the functions in reddit_groups.py are true (select all that apply)?

responses.wg_space_ve: walk_graph has an average space complexity of O(V + E).
responses.wg_time_ve: walk_graph has an average time complexity of O(V + E).
responses.fg_space_ve: find_groups has an average space complexity of O(V + E).
responses.fg_time_ve: find_groups has an average time complexity of O(V + E).

q5.question:
Use your reddit_groups.py script on the following graph:

10
10
1 2
2 3
3 4
4 1
10 5
9 8
3 10
3 1
9 6
5 2

Answer the following the questions:

  1. How many isolated groups are in the graph? ____
  2. Which vertices are in the largest group? ____
  3. What vertex is alone? ____
